lofas.author: Jeannette Lofas
lofas.text1: The stepfamily is not a broken family, it is a new family. It requires new rules, new roles, and new relationships.

retos.desc: Small gestures to break the ice.

pasos.texto: Greet him/her with a smile every morning, without expecting anything in return.
Ask how their day went and truly listen to the answer for at least 2 minutes.
Find something genuine to compliment (their clothes, a drawing, the way they helped).

retos.desc: The kitchen is a perfect place to bond.

pasos.texto: Ask what their favorite dish is that you cook at home.
Invite them to cook that favorite dish together this week.
During the meal, turn off phones and TV, and enjoy the moment together.

retos.desc: Dedicate exclusive time, free from distractions.

pasos.texto: Ask what activity they’d like to do with you for 30 minutes.
Schedule this moment in your calendar like an important appointment.
During those 30 minutes, give them your full attention (no phone).

retos.titulo: Challenge 4: The Power of a Simple Gift
retos.desc: A gesture that says 'I thought of you.'

pasos.texto: Pay attention to something they say they want or need (a pencil, comic book, etc.).
During the week, give them this small gift for no particular reason.
When giving it, simply say: 'This made me think of you.'

retos.desc: Show genuine interest in their passions.

pasos.texto: Ask them to show you their favorite video game, hobby, or pastime.
Let them explain the rules or how it works.
Play or participate with them for at least 20 minutes.

retos.desc: Create a special shared experience.

pasos.texto: Choose a movie or series together that you both enjoy.
Prepare popcorn or their favorite snack.
Turn off the lights and enjoy the 'cinema' as if it were a real event.

retos.desc: Create a safe space to communicate.

pasos.texto: Buy a nice notebook and explain that it’s a 'secret journal' just for both of you.
Write the first entry about a good moment you shared.
Leave it in their room so they can read and reply whenever they want.

retos.desc: A shared challenge strengthens connection.

pasos.texto: Find a YouTube tutorial on something that interests you both (a magic trick, a simple recipe, etc.).
Spend time practicing it together, laughing at your mistakes.
Show the result to the family or keep it just between you.

retos.desc: Go beyond just saying 'good job'.

pasos.texto: During the day, notice something they do well (doing homework, helping a sibling).
Instead of saying 'good job', say something specific: 'I admire how focused you were on that math problem.'
Observe their reaction to such a thoughtful compliment.

retos.titulo: Challenge 10: A 'Thanks for Being Here' Card
retos.desc: Acknowledge their presence in your life.

pasos.texto: Buy a postcard or make one yourself.
Write a sincere message about how happy you are that they’re part of the family.
Leave it on their pillow or in their bag for them to find.

retos.desc: Create an unforgettable memory.

pasos.texto: Research a nearby place neither of you has visited (a park, a small museum, a café).
Plan the 'trip' together: how to get there and what to do once you arrive.
Live the adventure! Take photos to remember the day.

retos.desc: Share your passion for sports.

pasos.texto: Invite them to play or practice their favorite sport (even if it's just tossing a ball at the park).
Cheer them on and celebrate their achievements, no matter how small.
If you don't like sports, suggest going for a walk or jog together while listening to music.

retos.desc: Encourage creativity and teamwork.

pasos.texto: Grab some LEGOs, building blocks, or even cardboard and tape.
Propose a challenge: 'let’s build the tallest house' or 'a castle for their toys'.
Work together on the project, no matter how it turns out.

retos.desc: The power of sharing a story.

pasos.texto: Let them choose a book they like (even if it's a comic).
Sit in a cozy place and take turns reading a chapter aloud.
At the end, talk about what you thought of the story or what might happen next.

retos.desc: The soundtrack of your relationship.

pasos.texto: Each of you picks 3 songs you like or that bring good memories.
Combine all the songs into one playlist on Spotify or YouTube.
Play the playlist in the car or at home while doing another activity.

retos.desc: Practice vulnerability in a safe way.

pasos.texto: Start a conversation like: 'Sometimes I feel a little [sad/nervous] when…', sharing something about yourself.
Ask if they’ve ever felt that way too.
Listen without judging and validate their feeling: 'I understand why you feel that way.'

retos.desc: A day to say 'yes' to everything (within reason).

pasos.texto: Announce that for one day you’ll try to say 'yes' to their ideas (within safe and reasonable limits).
When they ask for something (play a game, eat ice cream), say 'yes!' enthusiastically.
At the end of the day, talk about how fun it was to have a 'yes' day.

retos.desc: Strengthen your bond through a teamwork activity.

pasos.texto: Choose a small mission you can do together: fix something, cook, take care of a plant, or help with a simple task.
While doing it, talk only about what’s needed and let the teamwork speak for itself.
When you’re done, celebrate in some way: take a picture, share a joke, or give a small symbolic reward.

retos.titulo: Challenge 19: Visit a Place from Your Childhood
retos.desc: Share a piece of your story.

pasos.texto: Take them to a place that was important to you as a child (your school, a park where you used to play).
Tell them a personal story about what you used to do there.
Ask if there’s a place that’s special to them that you could visit together.

retos.titulo: Challenge 20: Write a Letter to the Future
retos.desc: Dream together and strengthen your long-term bond.

pasos.texto: Sit together and write a letter to your future selves a year from now.
Each person writes about what they hope will happen in that year (a trip, an achievement, etc.).
Keep the letters in an envelope and promise to open them together next year on that same date.

retos.titulo: Challenge 21: Create a Shared Movie List
retos.desc: A long-term project to share tastes and build traditions.

pasos.texto: Each person writes down 3 movies they’d love to watch.
Meet and read your lists together, looking for matches.
Pick the 3 movies with the most matches and add them to a master list.

retos.desc: Disconnect from screens to connect in real life.

pasos.texto: Choose a board game you both enjoy (cards, dice, etc.).
Prepare some snacks and drinks for game night.
Play for at least an hour with no digital distractions.

retos.desc: Practice patience and create a safe space for expression.

pasos.texto: For a full day, make a pact not to criticize or correct anything.
If something goes wrong, just smile and move on.
At the end of the day, talk about how you both felt.

retos.titulo: Challenge 24: Let Them Teach You Something New
retos.desc: Switch roles and let them be the teacher for once.

pasos.texto: Ask what skill or topic they’d like to teach you.
Take time to learn with patience and enthusiasm.
Thank them sincerely for the lesson, no matter how simple.

retos.titulo: Challenge 25: Create a Friendship Secret Code
retos.desc: A special symbol only you two know to strengthen your bond.

pasos.texto: Invent a secret gesture or word (e.g., touching your nose).
Use it in public to communicate without others understanding.
Make it your little ritual of complicity.

retos.desc: Look to the future and plan something exciting together.

pasos.texto: Talk about a place you’d like to visit together someday.
Do some research about that place (costs, things to do).
Create a shared ‘vacation fund’ jar and set a date.

retos.desc: Expressing gratitude in writing has amazing power.

pasos.texto: Each of you writes a thank-you letter to the other.
Read your letters aloud in a quiet place.
Keep the letters as a reminder of this special moment.

retos.desc: A creative and collaborative project that represents your bond.

pasos.texto: Gather all the pillows and cushions you have at home.
Design and build your fort together in the living room.
Spend the day playing inside and around your fort.

retos.desc: Give back to the community together and learn the value of selfless help.

pasos.texto: Research local charities where you can lend a hand.
Spend the day together participating in the chosen activity.
Talk about how it felt to help others.

retos.desc: Create a time capsule that captures a perfect moment in your relationship.

pasos.texto: Choose an object that represents a happy recent moment together.
Decide where to keep it (special box, shelf, etc.).
Write a small note with the date and why it’s special, and place it inside.

info.pregunta: What kind of music or artist makes them smile?
What is their favorite school subject (or the one they find easiest)?
What makes them laugh out loud?
What topic makes them nervous or uncomfortable?
What is their biggest fear or phobia?
What do they want to be when they grow up?
What has been the best gift you’ve ever given them?
Which shared activity do they enjoy the most?
How do they usually react when angry or frustrated?
What is their favorite movie or TV show?
What do you usually ask them to do when you need help at home?
Describe their personality in three words.
